translations.chinese: 詔曰：「代地居常山之北，與夷狄邊，趙乃從山南有之，遠，數有胡寇，難以為國。
translations.english: The edict said: "Dai territory lies north of Changshan, bordering the Yi and Di barbarians. Zhao then controls it from south of the mountains, which is distant. There are frequently Hu bandits, making it difficult to establish as a kingdom.

translations.chinese: 頗取山南 太原之地益屬代，代之雲中以西為雲中郡，則代受邊寇益少矣。
translations.english: Take much of the Taiyuan territory south of the mountains and add it to Dai. Make Dai's Yunzhong and west into Yunzhong commandery, then Dai will receive fewer border bandits.

translations.chinese: 王、相國、通侯、吏二千石擇可立為代王者。」
translations.english: Kings, prime ministers, noble marquises, officials of two thousand piculs, select who can be established as King of Dai."

translations.chinese: 燕王綰、相國何等三十三人皆曰：「子恆賢知溫良， 請立以為代王，都晉陽。」
translations.english: King Yan Wan, prime minister He and thirty-three others all said: "The son Heng is worthy, wise, gentle, and kind. Please establish him as King of Dai, capital at Jinyang."
